item.title: When Corporations Kill - Progressive Roundtable
item.description:
When Corporations Kill - Progressive Roundtable

Alex Lawson, Social Security Works & Sarah Badawi, Progressive Change Campaign Committee (PCCC) join Thom. Plus Special Panel Guest - Patty Lovera, Food & Water Watch. The Department of Justice is launching an investigation into the Dole Food company - one of the world's largest processors of fresh produce.

item.title: Guarding Against Chernobyl's Radioactive Forest Fires
item.description:
Guarding Against Chernobyl's Radioactive Forest Fires

Thirty years after the Chernobyl disaster, firefighters remain on high alert to prevent radioactive forest fires. Originally published at - http://www.rferl.org/media/video/guarding-against-chernobyls-radioactive-forest-fires/27691519.html

item.title: A Turning Point for China?
item.description:
A Turning Point for China?

In this film, William Nee discusses what it's like doing human rights work in China today, and tells the story of Pu Zhiqiang, one of China's most famous fre...

item.title: Masked Anti-Putin Protester Detained Again In Red Square
item.description:
Masked Anti-Putin Protester Detained Again In Red Square

Performance artist Roman Roslovtsev returned to Red Square to stage his latest masked protest against Russian President Vladimir Putin and a law on public ga...

item.title: Kerry Heads to Europe for Anti-Corruption Summit
item.description:
Kerry Heads to Europe for Anti-Corruption Summit

U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry begins a four-day diplomatic mission to Europe Monday where he will meet with officials from several countries and participate in an anti-corruption summit. The anti-corruption gathering Thursday is being hosted by British Prime Minister David Cameron, and will be attended by heads of state from Afghanistan, Colombia and Nigeria, among others.

item.title: Cameron Warns of Less Stable Europe if Britain Leaves EU
item.description:
Cameron Warns of Less Stable Europe if Britain Leaves EU

British Prime Minister David Cameron warned during a speech Monday that Britain would raise the risk of war if it chooses to leave the European Union in a referendum vote scheduled for later this year.

item.title: US Intel Agencies Blocked From Twitter-linked Service
item.description:
US Intel Agencies Blocked From Twitter-linked Service

Twitter has blocked American intelligence agencies from accessing a service that has proven itself helpful in fighting terrorism. The Wall Street Journal reported Sunday a senior U.S. intelligence official said access was blocked because Twitter seemed concerned about the appearance of being too friendly to the intelligence agencies.

item.title: Dozens Killed After Buses Collide With Fuel Tanker In Afghanistan
item.description:
Dozens Killed After Buses Collide With Fuel Tanker In Afghanistan

Officials say at least 50 people were killed when two passenger buses and a fuel tanker collided on a major highway in eastern Afghanistan. The collision happened in the morning on May 8 in the Muqur district of Ghazni Province, on the main highway linking the capital, Kabul, to the southern city of Kandahar.
